heading: managing monica
subheading: house prosecutors grilled monica lewinsky for a couple of hours on sunday, characterizing the session as "very constructive" even though she offered no revelations. as agreed, no sexual details were discussed. instead, they asked about the timing of president clinton's gifts to her and conversations between her and clinton about how lewinsky would respond to a subpoena in the paula jones case. the real point, though, was to establish the need to call witnesses in the senate impeachment trial, and that issue may be decided monday.
author: wired staff
text: house prosecutors grilled monica lewinsky for a couple of hours on sunday, characterizing the session as "very constructive" even though she offered no revelations. as agreed, no sexual details were discussed. instead, they asked about the timing of president clinton's gifts to her and conversations between her and clinton about how lewinsky would respond to a subpoena in the paula jones case. the real point, though, was to establish the need to call witnesses in the senate impeachment trial, and that issue may be decided monday.
